data.title: The Michelangelo Code
data.solution:
text = input()
numWords = int(input())
words = [''.join(x for x in input() if x.isalpha()) for _ in range(numWords)]


text = ''.join([x.lower() for x in text if x.isalpha()])
foundwords = []

# This is an optimization. You could just try all possible lengths, but it takes longer.
usefulLength = min(len(x) for x in words)

# Find all the words
for stepsize in range(1, len(text) // usefulLength + 1):
    for offset in range(0, stepsize):
        slicedtext = text[offset::stepsize]
        foundwords += [(w, offset, stepsize) for w in words if w in slicedtext]

# Identify the longest one
foundwords.sort(key=lambda x: len(x[0]))

longest, offset, stepsize = foundwords[-1]
i = text[offset::stepsize].index(longest)
relevantText = text[offset+(i*stepsize):offset+(i*stepsize)+(len(longest)-1)*stepsize+1]
print(''.join(x.upper() if a % stepsize == 0 else x for a, x in enumerate(relevantText)))
data.statement:
Are secret messages hidden in famous texts?

Search the given [[TEXT]] for evenly spaced letters which form [[WORD]]s from the given list. Ignore punctuation, capitalization, and spacing.

Print the section of [[TEXT]] that contains the longest hidden [[WORD]], in lowercase and omitting all non-letters. Highlight the hidden [[WORD]] with UPPERCASE. There will be only one such longest word.

testCases.title: Be punctual
testCases.testIn:
Blessed is he, who in the name of charity and good will, shepherds the weak through the valley of darkness, for he is truly his brother's keeper - and the finder of lost children. And I will strike down upon thee with great vengeance and furious anger those who would attempt to poison and destroy my brothers.

testCases.title: Be punctual
testCases.testIn:
When the Himalayan peasant meets the he-bear in his pride, he shouts to scare the monster, who will often turn aside. But the she-bear thus accosted rends the peasant tooth and nail, for the female of the species is more deadly than the male.

testCases.title: Tempus fugit
testCases.testIn:
I met a traveller from an antique land, who said: Two vast and trunkless legs of stone stand in the desert. Near them on the sand, half sunk, a shattered visage lies, whose frown and wrinkled lip and sneer of cold command tell that its sculptor well those passions read which yet survive, stamped on these lifeless things, the hand that mocked them and the heart that fed. And on the pedestal these words appear: 'My name is Ozymandias, King of Kings: Look on my works, ye mighty, and despair!' Nothing beside remains. Round the decay of that colossal wreck, boundless and bare, the lone and level sands stretch far away.
1039

data.stubGenerator:
read TEXT:string(1000)
read N:int
loop N read WORD:string(25)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A string of [[TEXT]] to search in.
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of words in the list.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> A string of a [[WORD]] to search for.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> The portion of [[TEXT]] which contains the longest [[WORD]], in lowercase except for the evenly spaced letters of [[WORD]], with all non-letters removed.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Are secret messages hidden in famous texts?

Search the given TEXT for evenly spaced letters which form WORDs from the given list. Ignore punctuation, capitalization, and spacing.

Print the section of TEXT that contains the longest hidden WORD, in lowercase and omitting all non-letters. Highlight the hidden WORD with UPPERCASE. There will be only one such longest word.
Input
Line 1: A string of TEXT to search in.
Line 2: An integer N for the number of words in the list.
Next N lines: A string of a WORD to search for.
Output
Line 1: The portion of TEXT which contains the longest WORD, in lowercase except for the evenly spaced letters of WORD, with all non-letters removed.
Constraints
Length of TEXT < 1000
1 ≤ N ≤ 2000
Length of WORD < 25
Example
Input
some wacky runes a tourist found
4
secret
hidden
invisible
message
Output
SomEwaCkyRunEsaT
